Name.item: Peterson Erosional Remnant, Point Barrow, Barrow Peninsula, Alaska

SampleLocationDescription.item: Vegetation on the PER is typical moist acidic tussock tundra dominated by a sedge-shrub assemblage consisting of Salix glauca (willow), Cassiope tetragona, Eriophorum vaginatum and Ledum palustre, with non-vascular plants such as Dicranum elongatum, Sphagnum and lichen species. Ice-wedge troughs contain Carex aquatilis (sedge). The presence of L. palustre on the PER is unique for the Barrow peninsula.
